pageContext.description: Winged upper section of winged palstave. Broken below base of wings. No stop ridge. Cast loop. Wings broken on upper shoulder. Hollow CAST in centre inch. Clay core held by U of bronze wire (see sketch).
pageContext.surface: Smooth but with small blow holes.
pageContext.associations: Part of hoard 1-8. Similar winged palstave with cast hollow in British Museum, "Addington 1913/14', 'Kent' (should be Surrey).
pageContext.publications: Victoria County History Surrey, Vol. I, Page 241,Proc. Soc. Ant. of London, ser. 2 xviii, 285, etsq.
pageContext.collection: Croydon Natural History and Scientific Society, Eldon House, 2 Landsdowne Rd., Croydon, Surrey
pageContext.site: England,Surrey,Beddlestead Green,Chelsham,"Found by a workman digging for flints.",1890
pageContext.remarks: Compiler would welcome information on other hollow winged types.,A B Reid.
